smell_analysis.justification: All provided diagram pages contain elements; no empty diagrams were found.

All use cases in the use case diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with actors either directly or via inclusion from an associated use case. The text lists in the package diagram (Page 1) are excluded per the rule definition.
No duplicate use case names describing the same activity were found associated with the same actor.
On Page 1 (Overview Diagram), inside the package 'Klassifikaatorite register', the element 'Auto_mark' is listed twice.
No redundancy found in data storage. Common columns like 'nimetus' or 'reg_aeg' represent distinct data for their respective entities (e.g., Car vs Person).
All use case names consistently start with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
All states in the State Diagram (Page 9) are reachable from the Start node.
All actions in the Activity Diagram (Page 4) are reachable via the decision flows.
All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators at both ends where required (e.g., 1, 0..*).
No diagram exceeds the threshold of 10 central elements. The largest is Page 15 with 9 tables.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single page. The maximum observed is 4 (e.g., 'Auto' on Page 12).
The layout of elements is generally uniform, with no distances exceeding twice the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found with 3 or fewer characters. Shortest identifiers like 'Riik' or 'Auto' are 4 characters long.
All class names start with uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto').
All attribute/column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'nimetus', 'isikukood').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto').
No type prefixes were found in element names. Standard key indicators like 'PK_' and 'FK_' are used, which are allowed.
